BY EDUCATIONAL AGENCIES
While this is a continuing responsibility of all constituent members of
JCEB, NAEB will assume primary responsibility for such stimulation
through its professional activities, publications, research library and
reports, and the consultative activities of its many members.
NETRC* s supporting activities normally will result from its regular
services to stations on the air and about to come on the air, and
specifically through its efforts toward Station Activation, as In Item
II above.
IV- NON-BROADCAST USES OF RADIO AND
TELEVISION IN EDUCATION
NAEB will assume responsibility for all services to closed circuit
television users, with the exception of furnishing actual program
materials supplied by NETRC. NAEB also will maintain close relations
with those in audio-visual and teaching device development so that
educational broadcasters generally may be kept aware of important
developments in these related fields.
V. INFORMATION SERVICES
NAEB will be responsible for collection and publication of research
findings and will endeavor to establish a national clearing house and
referral center for all those requiring data on any aspect of the use
of radio and television in education. NAEB also will continue to publish
a weekly Washington Report, a monthly Factsheet (similar to that
previously issued by JCET), and its regular professional Newsletter and
scholarly Iournal . It will also maintain a directory of educational
radio stations.
NETRC will publish the Directory of Educational Television Stations
(formerly tssued annually by JCET) and will maintain its present
publications. NET News. Inside Channels, and NET Annual Reports
together with such other special reports or publications as may be
necessary to Interpret activities of NETRC and affiliated stations to each
other, to the field, and to the general public.
NAEB and NETRC will attempt to coordinate their publications in order
to avoid duplication and to service adequately all those engaged
in or interested in educational radio and television.
